executive_summary: For most of the five years to 2022, the Coffee Store Franchises industry has experienced robust growth as the franchise model continued to be a popular method for large chains to expand its company footprint with relatively low capital investment. The largest industry player, Dunkin' Brands Group Inc. (Dunkin'), has added more than 1,500 franchises to its network during the current period, expanding into underrepresented regions relative to its traditional stronghold in the Northeast. Although rising consumer spending and improving economic conditions encouraged industry revenue growth during most of the period, the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and accompanying public mandates limiting public activity stifled industry revenue in 2020. Over the five years to 2022, IBISWorld expects industry revenue to grow an annualized 2.4% to $12.7 billion, including an estimated increase of 6.1% in 2022 alone. However, it is anticipated that industry profit will fall to 4.4% of industry revenue in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Coffee Store Franchises industry has performed well
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Coffee Store Franchises industry has performed well over most of the five years to 2022 as the franchise model continues to be a proven method for major chains to expand their footprint in the United States. Industry revenue has also been supported by rising per capita coffee consumption in the US. While heightened consumer spending and disposable income have boosted the industry, many coffee drinkers also perceive the beverage as a dietary staple for which they have inelastic demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Purchasing coffee has become more convenient
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Purchasing coffee has become more convenient than ever before, with many operators giving consumers the options to order ahead on mobile apps or through smart kiosks in the store. Additionally, a growing number of establishments have developed drive-through and delivery services. Locations outfitted with drive-through are expected to significantly outpace those without the extension amid the world health crisis as many stores prohibit in-store entry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: For many coffee drinkers, the beverage represents a dietary staple. These consumers exhibit inelastic demand for industry goods and are likely to continue to spend at industry establishments during times of economic uncertainty. However, even for the devout coffee consumer, several broad macroeconomic trends may moderate demand, as evident from the recent shock experienced by industry operators in 2020 amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Dunkin' Brands and Tim Hortons Expand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's primary source of establishment growth over the next five years will come from the major coffee store chains expanding into underrepresented states. For the Dunkin' segment of Dunkin' Brands, major growth markets include Texas, Colorado and California, which currently have very few per capita stores. Meanwhile, Tim Hortons is focused on building brand awareness in the United States, where it is relatively unknown.

Industry profitability is expected to remain stable over the next five years, despite an increase in sales volumes and the number of consumers resuming their indulgence on high-priced premium items. Larger operators are implementing several initiatives in attempt to boost profit, such as using technology to reduce wage costs. However, as industry activity continues to rise in line with anticipated economic growth, industry operators are expected to rehire workers to meet heightened demand.

industry_definition: This industry is composed of franchise establishments that prepare and serve coffee. Reports in our Business Franchise collection focus solely on the operation of franchised outlets and exclude nonfranchise data. They show the total number of franchise outlets, total franchise revenue and the average profit margin earned by franchisees. Our reports also highlight the largest franchisors by market share.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: As wages are expected to absorb a larger share of revenue in 2020, average industry profit is expected to fall
Coffee store franchises are becoming increasingly concentrated in the hands of fewer owners
The industry has benefited from greater consumer spending on breakfast goods over the past five years
For many coffee drinkers, the beverage represents a dietary staple
The industry's primary source of establishment growth will come from the major chains
Industry profitability is expected to remain stable despite an anticipated increase in sales volumes

market_segmentation.segment_description: Typically purchase less expensive items like brewed coffee. Account for an estimated 34.9% of revenue in 2022.
Have greater disposable incomes and value convenience. Estimated 20.6% of revenue in 2022.
Similar to 45-54 age group in disposable income and valuing convenience. Estimated 21.4% of revenue.
Frequent coffee shops but have lower disposable incomes. Estimated 14.6% of revenue in 2022.
Limited market, estimated 8.5% of revenue. Purchase small items, influenced by new product releases.

products_and_services.product_description: Coffee, iced/frozen coffee drinks, iced teas, hot chocolate, lattes, cappuccinos, teas, chai drinks.
Donuts, cookies, pastries, bagels, muffins, yogurt, ice cream, sandwiches, wraps, salads, fruit.
Packaged coffee beans/grounds, coffee pods, drinkware, cups, utensils, clothing.

tier_1_suppliers: Egg & Poultry Wholesaling in the US
Fish & Seafood Wholesaling in the US
Soft Drink, Baked Goods & Other Grocery Wholesaling in the US
Frozen Food Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The primary driver of consumption of coffee products from franchise stores is the level of per capita disposable income that consumers earn. Consumers adjust purchase decisions depending on their current and expected financial situation.

General sentiment toward the presiding economic climate influences consumer spending behavior. As consumer sentiment surrounding general economic conditions improves, they are more likely to spend rather than allocating a greater proportion toward savings.

Changes in population demographics also influence industry demand. Industry demand has been boosted by the baby-boomer generation, which has had greater access to higher disposable income than ever before.
Rising concerns regarding healthy eating have affected coffee franchise stores, which typically serve fast beverages and food products that are relatively high in calories.

Exogenous shocks can also have a substantial effect on industry revenue growth. For instance, the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and imposing government regulations contributed to the curb of indoor ordering and dining, which severely slowed demand for industry products and services.

international_trade_points.trade_description: As a retail industry, the Coffee Store Franchises industry does not involve in any international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is estimated to account for 25.4% of industry establishments in 2022, reflecting its 25.8% share of the US population. Major states include Florida (5.6% of locations), North Carolina (3.2%), and Virginia (2.7%).

The West region accounts for 22.7% of industry establishments, in line with its 23.5% share of the US population. California alone comprises 12.6% of locations due to its large population and high incomes.

The Mid-Atlantic region has 14.3% of establishments, outpacing its 13.4% population share. New York accounts for 6.9% of locations, while Pennsylvania and New Jersey have 3.7% and 2.8% respectively. This densely populated area has high disposable incomes.
The Great Lakes region comprises 11.9% of industry establishments, below its 14.9% population share.
The Southwest accounts for 9.1% of establishments, above its 7.5% population share.
The Plains region has 6.3% of industry locations, below its 6.8% population share.
New England comprises 5.6% of establishments, above its 4.6% population share.
The Rocky Mountains region accounts for 4.8% of locations, higher than its 3.5% population share.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry is subject to regulations from the FDA regarding food handling, presentation, and nutritional value guidelines.
The industry employs many low-skilled workers and is subject to minimum wage and employee benefits regulations like the Affordable Care Act.
All establishments operate under franchise agreements governed by federal and state franchising laws regarding disclosure, registration, and relationship laws.
Various regulations were implemented to curb COVID-19 transmission, such as restricting in-store services and requiring paid sick leave.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Franchisors encourage market entry by minimizing start-up costs related to establishing a franchise and also by providing support in the form of marketing, technology, advisory councils and training.
Industry operators immediately benefit from new technologies, such as mobile applications, gift cards and the ability to find locations and recognize them as a known brand instantly.
Despite assistance from franchisers, location provides a barrier for many prospective entrants. Highly concentrated and popular markets are often reserved for existing franchisees.

factors_increased_barrier: Industry assistance level is low and steady
Competition level is high and increasing
factors_decreased_barrier: Globalization level is low and steady

basis_points.basis_description: Operators primarily compete on the basis of location, price, assortment, consistency, convenience and quality of rendered products and services.

External competition is very high, with the industry's primary product available at a range of other establishments like non-franchise coffee stores, restaurants, snack shops, grocery stores, and home brewing systems.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top two players account for 89.9% of revenue in 2022. The industry is dominated by Dunkin' Brands Group Inc.
The role of large franchise networks that open hundreds of locations under the same franchise has grown, contributing to concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages comprise one of the industry's largest expenses since labor is required throughout every industry process, including food preparation, customer servicing and cleaning up.
Purchases represent the single largest expense with an estimated 42.6% of industry revenue dedicated to the purchase of food and beverage items that are sold in stores in 2022.
Coffee stores require basic commercial kitchen equipment, store fixtures and fittings, crockery and cutlery as well as a variety of machinery for producing coffee.

Often, industry marketing costs are subsidized by franchisors. Franchisees benefit from the national brand awareness of the franchisors' brand and typically do not pay for wide-scale national media campaigns.
Rent costs are high for industry operators that choose to locate in high-density or high-traffic areas with greater visibility.
Utilities are the costs associated with heating, cooling and powering industry establishments.
Other costs include general administrative costs and insurance fees. Additionally, franchisees incur royalty, licensing and franchise fees, which they must pay to the franchisor.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry primarily depends on labor because of the need for personal, face-to-face service and labor input in all areas of operation, including order taking, serving, food and beverage preparation, acceptance of deliveries, cleaning and management.
Start-up costs can be relatively high for a new industry entrant, with commercial kitchen equipment, furniture and decor required to set up a store.
Little ongoing capital investment is required for a coffee store franchise once it is up and running.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Spending at coffee stores is largely discretionary. Therefore, consumers may elect to purchase at-home brewing systems during instances of economic uncertainty as they limit discretionary purchases.
The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic negatively affected industry revenue in 2020.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Technological developments are primarily focused on customer service and payment systems to increase efficiency of operations, while not significantly altering the core services.
Mobile ordering initiatives and loyalty programs linked to mobile apps are becoming more common to improve customer experience and engagement.
Most operators now have point-of-sale systems in stores to speed up service, leading to larger purchases on average and cutting down on labor costs.
Social media platforms enable operators to connect directly with customers and tailor their brand's message to target consumer segments.

FAQs.question: How does your company market deals on e-commerce sites, such as Groupon, to generate new customers?
FAQs.answer: Promotional offerings and exposure to consumers can increase brand loyalty and frequency of patronization.

FAQs.question: How do review sites, such as Yelp and Google Reviews, affect sales?
FAQs.answer: Generating positive reviews through superior customer service can help increase foot traffic and pique the interest of first-time consumers.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities to expand your market share?
FAQs.answer: Acquisitions can help increase scale and enhance segment portfolios in order to diversify revenue streams.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in high traffic areas to increase visibility?
FAQs.answer: Locating in high density areas ensures a steady stream of demand for industry operators.

FAQs.question: Does your company leverage mobile booking applications to streamline the booking process?
FAQs.answer: Developing an online ordering experience could lure a larger amount of customers and help lower overall lead times.

FAQs.question: What point-of-sale systems (i.e. Square) does your company use to reduce labor costs?
FAQs.answer: Automating point-of-sale systems either entirely or for a fraction of transactions minimizes reliance on labor.

FAQs.question: What measures does your company take to ensure all employees are compliant with food handling and safety laws?
FAQs.answer: Regulations regarding product safety, nutritional content and menu labeling vary between municipalities.

FAQs.question: Is your company compliant with the varying labor regulations across states?
FAQs.answer: The industry employs a high number of workers at hourly rates and, therefore, is subject to minimum wage and employee benefits regulations.

FAQs.question: How does your company's inventory turnover rate compare to your major competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Supply-chain efficiency is crucial to maintaining a competitive edge over others.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Achieving lower profit margins amid heightened competition suggests that inefficiencies may exist in a company's supply chain in relation to its major competitors. Industry profit is expected to account for 4.6% of revenue in 2023.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain a clear position in the market?
FAQs.answer: Owning a clear position in the market against competitors enables franchise stores to win business based on brand reputation.

FAQs.question: What measures do you have in place to reduce operational costs?
FAQs.answer: Cost controls with minimal waste are important to low-margin service industries.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain skilled employees?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators require a supply of seasonal workers that can complete a range of tasks in industry stores.

FAQs.question: How does your company respond to fluctuating input prices?
FAQs.answer: Coffee beans are a major input for coffee stores and rising prices can harm franchise operators' profit margins as they are unable to raise prices in the short term.

FAQs.question: The world price of coffee is expected to decrease in 2023.
How significantly does consumer confidence affect product demand?
FAQs.answer: The Consumer Confidence Index measures consumers' perceptions about their current and future financial prospects. In 2023, the consumer confidence index is expected to decrease.

FAQs.question: How do you measure trends in consumer spending?
FAQs.answer: Factors that influence consumer spending affect the industry. Consumer spending is expected to increase in 2023.
